alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Leavenworth; Miami (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 29 at 9:18PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Miami, south central Leavenworth and Johnson Counties through 945 PM CDT... At 917 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Wellsville, or near Edgerton, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Overland Park, Olathe, Shawnee, Lenexa, Gardner, Merriam, De Soto, Paola, Spring Hill, Osawatomie, Louisburg, Edgerton, Lake Quivira, Linwood, Hillsdale, Chiles, Clare, Bucyrus, Lackmans and Clearview City. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 in Kansas between mile markers 200 and 230. Interstate 435 between mile markers 0 and 7, and between mile markers 80 and 83. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for northeastern and east central Kansas.
